Name: Yogesh
Compliment: I really appreciate how you guide the conversation and make everything so relatable with your viewers. Your vision of how sales actually work at the enterprise level, and the way you turned a personal concern into real impact, is truly inspiring. This discussion is so insightful because of both of you.

Name: Joe
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Vasu Kulkarni mentioned treating venture like an art and a science while Joe kept pulling out those gritty, athlete-minded stories about resilience and rejection—it made the whole conversation feel unusually honest and motivating.

Name: Ignite
Compliment: Really liked how, in the recent episode, Rob Hodgkinson mentioned focusing the model on eliminating zeros and indexing the very best Series B investors, and how Brian kept tying that back to liquidity and real-world outcomes for founders and LPs.

Name: Innovate or Evaporate Podcast
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Peter Walker mentioned that not every great business needs to chase VC money, and the way Toph held space for that nuanced, founder-first perspective made the conversation feel refreshingly honest.

Name: TCA Venture Group
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, David mentioned grounding early-stage investing in real data instead of hype, and how you both kept the conversation brutally honest yet encouraging for angels and founders navigating 2025’s tougher funding landscape.

Name: Sub Club
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Greg Cohn mentioned that most early-stage consumer apps don’t actually need VC and should instead focus on building a durable, self-sustaining business, and how David drew out that nuance so clearly in the discussion.​

Name: Inside Hard2beat
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Dr. Łukasz Tokarski openly connected the hard science of vagus nerve stimulation with the everyday reality of Alzheimer’s patients, and how the host guided that complex topic into such an accessible, hopeful conversation.

Name: Gabe
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Pascal mentioned turning his family’s 3.5M portfolio crisis into a disciplined LP strategy, and you guided that conversation to highlight both the emotional weight and the practical, step‑by‑step framework for investors.

Name: EUVC
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Ole Lehmann mentioned treating every piece of content as a low-cost experiment to find “content–market fit,” and how Andreas drew out the implications for a new wave of European solopreneurs.

Name: AIMS Podcast
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Jeanne Bolger mentioned that shift from treating individual patients to backing innovations that can impact millions, and how Ann held space for both the vulnerability of those career pivots and the excitement of real-world scale.

Name: Growth With AI
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Adam Olenn mentioned treating AI like a wide-thinking intern while protecting the uniquely human “fortress” of meaning, and how you guided that into such a grounded, emotionally honest conversation about brand storytelling.

Name: Erica
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode of Trailblazers Podcast, Claire Hughes Johnson mentioned that scaling isn’t about adding headcount but about “repeatably delivering excellence” through clear standards, operating principles, and honest expectations-setting.

Name: Caroline
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Stephanie mentioned using vision boards, journaling, and that 30‑day calendar check-in to reframe hard seasons—your back-and-forth made growth, resilience, and goal-setting feel tangible instead of cliché.

Name: Aisha
Compliment: Really liked how in the recent episode, Varun Jain mentioned the EIPA model and you both broke it down into such simple, actionable steps that any parent or student could follow without feeling overwhelmed or intimidated.
